texto: Grew Studevs from 0 → 160+ members in ~12 months by launching a challenge-driven program and recruiting peer leaders, measured by active participation and shipped projects.
Drove 13+ national awards by facilitating and spearheading 12+ events/hackathons, implementing pre-mortems and review rituals that raised submission quality.
Unlocked university sponsorship by pitching leadership with a concrete outcomes roadmap, enabling national-level participation and funding.

Spearheaded the development of a hierarchical admin system, establishing roles for founders, admins, alumni, and participants to ensure long-term continuity. The system has remained active for 2.5 years, sustaining 3 generations of leadership... and counting.
Reached 300+ organic impressions by deploying narrative-first content and alumni spotlights, increasing event sign-ups and partner interest.
Catalyzed 10 Mitacs GRI wins & 6 Big Tech/YC placements via targeted mentorship, application playbooks, and mock interviews.
Collected ~600 kg of plastic caps by launching a multi-campus drop-box program and weekly pickups over the run, documented with partner receipts.
Delivered 8,640 batteries + 5,000 cigarette butts to SEGAM by standardizing collection → storage → handoff, ensuring safe disposal.
Mobilized 50+ volunteers for clean-up initiatives and community challenges by coordinating schools and volunteers, coupling advocacy with real cleanup.
Reached ~200 students with a sustainability talk at an entrepreneurship fair by packaging “act-measure-share” playbooks teens could replicate.

Delivered 600 kg (≈216,000 caps) in 12 weeks by installing collection containers across 5 schools and running weekly campus-captain pickups, surpassing the 28 kg baseline by ~21×, validated via weigh-in and AMANC handoff.
Mobilized up to 20 volunteers by defining roles, shifts, and checklists, achieving zero missed pickups and an on-time campaign close.
Executed 2 holiday events (AMANC + girls’ shelter) by coordinating logistics and partners (incl. TecMilenio robotics), enabling the donation of ~25 toys and structured activities.
Standardized cross-campus execution with a simple starter kit (what/where/how), reducing setup friction and keeping all five sites active for the full 12 weeks.
Launched a student coordination from 0 → enduring (6 generations) by formalizing mission, rules, and succession, evidenced by the group’s continuity as Sociedad Estudiantil CSA.
Delivered two campus-wide events on time (Día de Muertos contest, Talent Show) by instituting a repeatable playbook and role clarity, achieving smooth execution with no incidents.
Reduced approval friction by creating a formal student ↔ Catholic Mothers leadership channel, accelerating cultural initiatives from proposal to execution.
Increased organizational durability by documenting processes and executing a structured handoff, enabling new cohorts to scale on a proven base.
Delivered 70% of total work across research, design, and app dev in 4 months by running weekly check-ins and risk burn-down, keeping a 4-member team on track to demo on time.
Reduced clinical ambiguity by formalizing a dermatologist-guided Design Thinking loop (3 interviews → insights → UI revisions), improving result-screen clarity.
De-risked evaluation with a seeded, stratified 80/20 split and a documented augmentation pipeline, enabling consistent comparison across runs.
Won 1st place (national) at University Entrepreneur Battle 2023 @ Talent Land by packaging a clear story: balanced data, lean CNN, and clinician-centric UX.
Delivered a two-sided MVP in 4 days by sequencing research → atomic design → Flutter build, enabling a clean live demo on time.
Increased judge resonance by reframing “dieting” into choice + reward loops, landing a top-4 highlight in Salud Digna.
De-risked scope with explicit acceptance criteria (must: plan match, roulette, challenges, rewards), keeping a 4-person team aligned under hackathon pressure.
Increased team productivity 30% by rolling out SCRUM (Jira/Slack/Confluence) and Figma libraries, measured by story points completed/sprint vs. the first two sprints.
Improved user acceptance 40% by executing 4 usability cycles and pivoting to shorter acronym loops with clearer rewards, measured via prototype “would-use weekly” responses from test participants.
Compressed approval cycles by instituting weekly design crit + decision logs, keeping stakeholders aligned and eliminating rework late in the program.
